newsitem.title: UK: New York City to launch two dollar deals next week.
newsitem.headline: New York City to launch two dollar deals next week.

text.p: New York City will launch two taxable dollar-denominated deals next week, a spokesperson at Goldman Sachs said on Wednesday.
She said there will be a competitive bid for $120 million of fixed-rate bonds.
The expected maturities will range from 1999 to 2004 with approximately $17 to $24 million maturing in each of these years subject to adjustment.
The second offering will be a floating-rate note for $50 million lead-managed by Goldman Sachs.
Maturities are expected to range from 1998 to 2002, with around $12 million maturing in each of these years.
Pricing of the bonds is expected on Wednesday April 9.
The bonds will be launched in conjunction with a $900 million tax-exempt domestic transaction in the U.S.
